thread.title: Man allegedly attempts to abduct young girl from Nova Scotia hotel
thread.title_full: Man allegedly attempts to abduct young girl from Nova Scotia hotel

title: Man allegedly attempts to abduct young girl from Nova Scotia hotel
text:
Man allegedly attempts to abduct young girl from Nova Scotia hotel 
Police tape is seen in this undated file photograph. The Canadian Press Published Monday, February 27, 2017 10:44AM EST 
TRURO, N.S. -- Police in Nova Scotia are looking for a man who allegedly tried to abduct an eight-year-old girl from a hotel in Truro. 
Truro police Insp. Rob Hearn says several young girls were on the second floor of the hotel near a vending machine on Saturday around 5 p.m. when they were approached by a stranger. 
Hearn says the man put his hands on one of the girls, as if to "to keep the child with him," and the girls screamed and resisted. 
He says the children managed to get away from the man and run to their parents. 
Hearn says the man fled the area, and police are still looking for him. 
He's described as about six feet tall and may have a tattoo around the area of one of his eyes.
